Around the World: A Separation

Andrew Young looks at the Oscar award-winning Iranian drama of the difficulties surrounding a failing relationship

Around the World: Son of Saul

Morgan Simpson praises the Oscar winning Hungarian film that depicts a harrowing account of the Holocaust

Around the World: Neruda

Chay Quinn reviews Pablo Larrain's latest drama surrounding the brutal suppression of Communism in Chile in 1948

Around the World: The Teacher

Michaela Cervenova looks at the recent black comedy from Czech film director Jan Hrebejk set in early 1980s Czechoslovakia.

Comedy Show review: Shaggers

Andrew Young looks at the success of four comedians, showcasing their talents on the topic of shagging

Around the World: Bicycle Thieves

Giulia De Vita looks at the Italian neorealist classic Bicycle Thieves, a film that explored the economic struggles of post-WWII Italy

Around the World: Hard To Be A God

Cameron Craig looks at the underrated world of Russian cinema with Aleksei German's three hour epic

Around the World: Pather Panchali

Veer Sharma delves into India's film industry with Satyajit Ray's 1955 classic about an impoverished priest who leaves his village in search of a better life

Around the World: Platform

Yun Xie discusses Platform which tells the story of a theatre troop and how their lives are effected by the social and cultural changes in China from 1979 to 1989

Around the World: The White Ribbon

Martin Kirsch looks at Michael Haneke's depiction of life in a German village just before the start of WWI

Around the World: Chopper

Michael Maitland-Jones looks at this biopic of one of Australia's most notorious criminals

Around the World: Throne of Blood

Cameron Craig looks at a film from one of the master's of Japanese cinema, Akira Kurosawa.

Retro Review: Maurice

Before Call Me By Your Name, James Ivory directed this landmark piece of LGBTQ cinema during the 80s

Review: Skyscraper

Dwayne Johnson's latest vehicle fails to pack a punch, writes Cameron Craig

By Patrick Walker

Review: First Reformed

Dan Molloy is thoroughly impressed by this brilliantly written Paul Schrader thriller

Cameron Craig is amazed by this animated adventure classic.

Chay Quinn is captivated by the toe-tapping return to the Greek Island, Kalokairi.

Review: Incredibles 2

Thomas Ron gets nostalgic watching the sequel that's just as super as the original.

Review: Leave No Trace
